bibl.note: Greer and Vinsinger Family Collection of American Revolutionary War Documents

In this letter to Egbert Benson, Oliver Wolcott notes that he has examined the papers Benson left him regarding Anthony Walton White. Wolcott claims to understand the nature of White's claims and agrees to preserve the papers on file in his office until White calls for a settlement.

div.p: I have examined the papers which you left in my hands relative to the accounts of Anthony Walton White, and find, that his claims have been the subject of a report of the Secretary of War, to the House of Representatives of the United States.

If I rightly understand the nature of Mr. White's claims, they can only be adjusted in consequence of explanations to be received from himself. I shall therefore preserve the papers on file in this office, until Mr. White shall call for a settlement.

closer.salute:
I have the honour to be with great respect,
Sir,
Your obedt. Servt.
